Financial Aid Office
Division of Administration & Finance















You are hereFAO Home ›  
Cost of Attendance






The Cost of Attendance (COA), also referred to as the student budget, is a standard estimated total of a student’s expenses while attending school. Your total financial aid for the award period cannot exceed this amount. The Food & Housing, Transportation, and Personal & Miscellaneous components of the COA are based on the Housing plan for SSU that you reported on the FAFSA. Click the links in the menu at the left to view detailed COA information for available academic years.
Net Price Calculator
The Net Price Calculator uses institutional data to provide estimated net price information to current and prospective students and their families based on a student’s individual circumstances. You can use the Net Price Calculator to estimate your financial aid eligibility information and compare it to the average cost of attending CSU campuses.
